description: A woman's impending visit excites Jerry, until he learns she's getting married.
title: The Seinfeld Chronicles

description: Jerry goes to great lengths to find and woo a woman he met at a party.
title: The Stake Out

description: Jerry's plans to move to a new apartment are complicated by George and Elaine.
title: The Robbery

description: Jerry breaks off an unusual friendship with a fellow (Kevin Dunn) he has disliked for years.
title: Male-Unbonding

description: George and Jerry invest in falling stock after a bad tip from a stock-market shyster.
title: The Stock Tip

description: Jerry gives George advice on breaking up and then finds himself in the same boat.
title: The Ex-Girlfriend

description: Jerry feels responsible for the death of an elderly woman (Rozsika Halmos) he upset the day before.
title: The Pony Remark

description: Jerry buys a very expensive suede jacket but learns that clothes don't always make the man.
title: The Jacket

description: George enlists Jerry's help in removing a message that he left on a date's (Tory Polone) answering machine.
title: The Phone Message

description: Jerry encourages Elaine to move into the vacant apartment in his building.
title: The Apartment

description: Jerry suspects his new cleaning person (Michael D. Conway) of stealing a statue he had promised to George.
title: The Statue

description: George plots revenge on his former boss (Fred Applegate); Jerry seeks to get even with a laundromat owner (John Capodice).
title: The Revenge

description: Hypochondriac George gets advice from a "holistic" healer (Stephen Tabolowsky) for his claimed heart attack.
title: The Heart Attack

description: Jerry and Elaine come up with one stipulation when they discuss getting back together as a couple.
title: The Deal

description: Jerry's cable TV installer (Vic Polizos) shows up on the day Elaine is using his apartment for a baby shower.
title: The Baby Shower

description: Jerry and his friends have difficulty getting a table at a crowded Chinese restaurant.
title: The Chinese Restaurant

description: George feels responsible for getting a busboy fired and tries to make it up to him.
title: The Busboy

description: Jerry persuades a dentist friend (Ralph Bruneau) to prescribe an expensive massage for medical reasons.
title: The Note

description: George tries honesty when he explains to his new girlfriend (Valerie Mahaffey) why they must break up.
title: The Truth

description: Jerry and Elaine go to Florida when a condo association honors his father.
title: The Pen

description: Jerry is in charge of a troublesome dog and is stuck in his apartment, which leaves George and Elaine stranded together with very little in common.
title: The Dog

description: The library has no record of Jerry returning a book he took out in 1971.
title: The Library

description: Jerry and his friends lose their car in the multilevel parking garage at a huge mall.
title: The Parking Garage

description: Jerry's attempt to increase business at a small cafe backfires; George regrets agreeing to an IQ test.
title: The Cafe

description: Jerry is shocked to hear the naughty suggestions on his tape recorder; George sees Elaine in a new light.
title: The Tape

description: Jerry straddles the fence regarding his latest flame (Tawny Kitaen); George's attention is focused on his date's (Susan Diol) nose.
title: The Nose Job

description: After a party, and much to the host's chagrin, Jerry and Elaine wait for Kramer to pick them up.
title: The Stranded

description: Elaine breaks up with her 66-year-old beau (Edward Penn), who suffers a stroke in front of Jerry's apartment.
title: The Alternate Side

description: Jerry is unintentionally responsible for Elaine's romantic woes; George gives Elaine a cashmere sweater.
title: The Red Dot

description: Jerry, Elaine, George and Kramer have unique experiences on their subway rides.
title: The Subway

description: George worries over gaining the upper hand in his current romance.
title: The Pez Dispenser

description: Jerry worries that his comatose neighbor will recover and seek revenge; George fears a plane crash.
title: The Suicide

description: Elaine and Jerry arrange a date for George with one of her unattached friends (Maggie Jakobson).
title: The Fix-Up

description: Jerry's baseball hero, Keith Hernandez, falls for Elaine; George schemes to extend his unemployment benefits.
title: The Boyfriend Part 1 & 2

description: Jerry and George commandeer a limousine headed for a neo-Nazi rally.
title: The Limo

description: Jerry tracks down a hit-and-run driver (Melinda McGraw); George skips town to escape an irate husband.
title: The Good Samaritan

description: After Jerry breaks up with his new girlfriend (Catherine Keener), she resorts to someone else's words to woo him back.
title: The Letter

description: George and Elaine have some explaining to do when they take Jerry's car for a ride.
title: The Parking Space

description: Becoming annoyed at Kramer's invasions of privacy, Jerry takes away his spare key. Kramer, shaken, decides to leave for California to pursue an acting career.
title: The Keys

description: When Jerry is booked to appear on "The Tonight Show," he takes George with him to Los Angeles to search for Kramer, who vanished in a huff months earlier.
title: The Trip (1)

description: While in Los Angeles, Jerry and George are picked up by the police; Kramer is a suspect in a series of serial murders.
title: The Trip (2)

description: Jerry is approached by network executives and asked to to create a new television show. Jerry tries to evade a vengeful writer; Kramer agrees to be a witness at a friend's trial; George woos an executive.
title: The Pitch & The Ticket

description: Jerry tries to explain to his visiting parents (Liz Sheridan, Barney Martin) the whereabouts of a gift they once gave him.
title: The Wallet

description: Jerry tries to buy back the watch his parents gave him; George attempts to renegotiate his network deal.
title: The Watch

description: Jerry gets lost en route to visiting a sick fan who must live in a protective plastic bubble.
title: The Bubble Boy

description: Jerry and George try to write the pilot for their series; Kramer solicits cigars from the Cuban consulate.
title: The Cheever Letters

description: A night at the opera turns into a nightmare when Jerry meets Elaine's new boyfriend (Peter Crombie).
title: The Opera

description: Jerry and George must think of an idea for a TV series before meeting with network bigwigs.
title: The Virgin

description: Jerry challenges George, Kramer and Elaine to a contest of self-denial; Elaine looks forward to a special date.
title: The Contest

description: Jerry parties it up in first class while Elaine suffers in cramped coach; Kramer is chased by the police.
title: The Airport

description: Elaine accidentally reveals too much cleavage on her Christmas card; Kramer is asked to pose for a risque underwear ad.
title: The Pick

description: Jerry is shadowed by a pesky comic (Barry Diamond); the gang's decision to meet for a movie begins in disaster.
title: The Movie

description: Jerry takes pity on a foreigner (Brian George) when the man's immigration papers are left in Jerry's mailbox.
title: The Visa

description: Jerry and George meet with a skeptical TV executive about their show; Kramer dates Jerry's ex-girlfriend.
title: The Shoes

description: An eavesdropping college reporter prints the mistaken story that Jerry and George are longtime intimate companions.
title: The Outing

description: When Jerry, George and Elaine volunteer to comfort senior citizens in their homes, it leads to disaster for all.
title: The Old Man

description: Jerry dumps his girlfriend when he finds out she may have breast implants; Kramer claims to have seen Salman Rushdie at a health club.
title: The Implant

description: When Jerry and Kramer observe an operation, they accidentally drop a candy into the surgical cavity.
title: The Junior Mint

description: A car valet with killer body odor leaves Jerry and Elaine gasping for breath; George sees an ex-girlfriend holding hands with someone else.
title: The Smelly Car

description: George's father (Jerry Stiller) is arrested when Jerry and George park his car in a handicapped spot.
title: The Handicap Spot

description: Jerry and George produce their pilot, but George doesn't like the actor playing him; Kramer has a personal problem.
title: The Pilot Part 1 & 2

description: Jerry begs Elaine for another chance when she reveals her true feelings about their relationship; Kramer is banned from his favorite fruit shop.
title: The Mango

description: Jerry appears on "Today" with Bryant Gumbel, but must wear a silly shirt as the result of a misunderstanding with Kramer's "low talker" girlfriend; George moves in with his parents.
title: The Puffy Shirt

description: George and Elaine go to an optician after George loses his glasses at his health club; Elaine fears she has rabies after being bitten by a dog.
title: The Glasses

description: Jerry, Kramer and Newman (Wayne Knight) investigate their accountant's unexplained sniffles; Elaine's new boyfriend has an annoying habit.
title: The Sniffing Accountant

description: Jerry and Elaine are apprehensive about being the godparents to their friends' newborn son; George is thrilled with his new parking spot.
title: The Bris

description: George asks Jerry's date (Marlee Matlin) to read the lips of his ex-girlfriend at a party; Elaine has trouble communicating with a limo driver.
title: The Lip Reader

description: Jerry and Elaine begin gaining weight and suspect a nonfat-yogurt shop may be making false claims; Jerry's use of a bad word influences Maryedith's son.
title: The Non-Fat Yogurt

description: Jerry decides to change barbers because his has a history of giving bad haircuts; George poses as an employee after a job interview.
title: The Barber

description: Jerry becomes tense when he can't get his masseuse girlfriend (Jennifer Coolidge) to give him a massage.
title: The Masseuse

description: Elaine's American Indian friend thinks Jerry is a racist after he gives Elaine a cigar-store Indian statue as a present.
title: The Cigar Store Indian

description: Jerry thinks his girlfriend (Kimberly Campbell) has a fungus; George converts to the Latvian Orthodox religion.
title: The Conversion

description: Elaine's toilet stall has no tissue and the woman in the next stall refuses to give her some; George acts giddy around Elaine's boyfriend (Dan Cortese).
title: The Stall

description: Jerry, Elaine, George and Kramer search for something to take to a dinner party; Jerry and Elaine forget to take a number at the bakery; Kramer and George have trouble buying wine.
title: The Dinner Party

description: George poses as a marine biologist while on a date with a former college classmate (Rosalind Allen); Elaine loses her electronic organizer.
title: The Marine Biologist

description: Jerry becomes obsessed when his date refuses to sample his pie; a clothing store mannequin resembles Elaine.
title: The Pie

description: Kramer befriends a little person when he is hired as a stand-in for a soap opera; George wants to break up with a girlfriend.
title: The Stand-In

description: Jerry lets his girlfriend (Courteney Cox) pose as his wife so she can receive a discount at the dry cleaner.
title: The Wife

description: Kramer has a scheme to sell vintage raincoats; Jerry and his girlfriend can't get any alone time; George sells his father's cabana clothes.
title: The Raincoats Part 1 & 2

description: George dates a woman who has a son. She invites him to her son's birthday party. While at the party, a fire breaks out in the kitchen.
title: The Fire

description: George fears Jerry's girlfriend will give his girlfriend an inaccurate description after she sees him naked.
title: The Hamptons

description: George learns success lies in doing the opposite of what he would normally do; Kramer appears on "Live -- Regis & Kathie Lee."
title: The Opposite

description: Kramer acts as chaperone when Jerry goes on a date with Miss Rhode Island (Marguerite MacIntyre).
title: The Chaperone

description: George's date gets credit for a salad purchase; Newman once dumped Jerry's date; Kramer clashes with a former athlete.
title: The Big Salad

description: Jerry convinces George to ask baseball player Danny Tartabull to appear on a public television pledge drive.
title: The Pledge Drive

description: A series of mishaps occur when George's phone lines get crossed and a woman answers when anyone calls.
title: The Chinese Woman

description: Jerry's purchase of a new sofa helps Elaine land a new romantic interest when she begins dating the man who delivered it (David James Elliott).
title: The Couch

description: Elaine must substitute for her boss in a merger deal; a girlfriend's mom sees George eating out of the trash.
title: The Gymnast

description: Jerry is forced to treat an obnoxious comic (Stephen Hytner) to dinner after accepting a designer suit.
title: The Soup

description: Elaine wins her boss (Ian Abercrombie) a chance to walk in the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. George buys the car of a celebrity.
title: The Mom & Pop Store

description: George hires a dowdy assistant (Vicki Lewis) whose competence and productivity prove to be a turn-on.
title: The Secretary

description: Jerry is challenged to a race by a former high-school classmate; Kramer fights for his rights as a store Santa.
title: The Race

description: George discovers Kramer's first name while trying to determine whether his girlfriend has an eating disorder.
title: The Switch

description: Given a familiar label maker, Jerry becomes suspicious of the friend (Bryan Cranston) who gave it to him.
title: The Label Maker

description: A friend (Jon Lovitz) fakes illness to get Jerry's sympathy; Kramer obstructs justice.
title: The Scofflaw

description: Highlights of the funniest moments from the first 100 episodes, including the characters' botched relationships and catchphrases.
title: The Highlights of 100 Part 1 & 2

description: Elaine tries to convert a gay acquaintance (Robert Mailhouse) to heterosexuality; George and his date have secrets.
title: The Beard

description: Jerry runs into trouble with Elaine's friend Wendy (Wendie Malick) after he decides to stop kissing acquaintances.
title: The Kiss Hello

description: Jerry covers for a hostile doorman (Larry Miller) at Elaine's boss's (Ian Abercrombie) apartment; George's father is living with him.
title: The Doorman

description: Kramer's numbing experience at the dentist wins him a spot in a charity concert; George is accused of stealing.
title: The Jimmy

description: Jerry is forced to flee his apartment when it must be bug-bombed for fleas, which prevents Elaine from getting a manuscript she needs.
title: The Doodle

description: Jerry feels betrayed when his method of pleasing a woman is used on Elaine by a friend (Patrick Warburton).
title: The Fusilli Jerry

description: Jerry plans to meet a supermodel at an airport lounge; Mr. Pitt tells Elaine he has mentioned her in his will; George tries to prove he isn't racist; Kramer gambles with a Texan.
title: The Diplomat's Club

description: Elaine's boyfriend shows his support for a hockey team by painting his face and taunting opposing fans.
title: The Face Painter

description: George and Jerry are suspected of roughing up Bette Midler in a softball game, giving Jerry's girlfriend, Bette's understudy, a chance to take the stage.
title: The Understudy

description: A pact with Jerry prompts George to offer former girlfriend Susan (Heidi Swedberg) a proposal; Elaine's sleep is interrupted by a barking dog.
title: The Engagement

description: George tries to find a way to persuade Susan (Heidi Swedberg) to postpone their wedding; Elaine's dog problem is solved by a rabbi with a cable show.
title: The Postponement

description: Jerry is challenged when Elaine's boyfriend insists it is impossible to rent a villa in the Tuscany region of Italy.
title: The Maestro

description: An uncontrollable wink creates problems for George and Kramer.
title: The Wink

description: Jerry tries to ensure that Elaine's houseguest (Jeremiah Birkett) doesn't sleep through the New York Marathon.
title: The Hot Tub

description: Jerry must choose between his girlfriend (Alexandra Wentworth) and a bowl of soup when a vendor (Larry Thomas) refuses to serve her.
title: The Soup Nazi

description: George tries to conceal his ATM code from his fiancee, Susan (Heidi Swedberg); Elaine is intrigued by a man she met at a party.
title: The Secret Code

description: The swimming pool maintenance man (Carlos Jacott) at Jerry's health club is convinced he is Jerry's best friend.
title: The Pool Guy

description: Elaine realizes that the manufacturer of her birth control device has gone out of business and its product is in limited supply.
title: The Sponge

description: Lloyd Braun (Matt McCoy) gets Jerry packs of a special brand of Chinese gum; George runs into a former neighbor.
title: The Gum

description: A loaf of rye bread becomes a point of contention when George's and Susan's parents have dinner together.
title: The Rye

description: A caddie (Armin Shimerman) helps Kramer improve his golf game; George is considered for a promotion at work.
title: The Caddy

description: A girlfriend (Lisa Deanne) piques Jerry's interest by always wearing the same dress; Kramer expects Elaine to honor an offer made in jest.
title: The Seven

description: Jerry buys his parents (Barney Martin, Liz Sheridan) a Cadillac, which only complicates their lives; George rethinks his engagement.
title: The Cadillac Part 1 & 2

description: Jerry pays a price for mocking his uncle (Len Lesser) on "The Tonight Show"; tenants hate new shower heads.
title: The Shower Head

description: George is dismayed because one of the dolls in Susan's collection bears an uncanny resemblance to his mother.
title: The Doll

description: Jerry's new membership in the Friars Club is jeopardized when a jacket he borrowed from the club gets lost.
title: The Friars Club

description: George introduces Kramer to the person in charge of the wigs for "Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat.".
title: The Wig Master

description: George ingratiates himself with his boss (Lee Bear) by sharing a delectable eggplant calzone with him.
title: The Calzone

description: Jerry's mechanic (Brad Garrett) steals his car; Kramer and Newman plan to return used bottles to Michigan. Kramer spots Jerry's stolen car in Ohio; Elaine gives Peterman JFK's golf clubs; George is institutionalized.
title: The Bottle Deposit Part 1 & 2

description: Jerry and Elaine get a chance for romance after George's comment to a couple (Debra Messing, Cary Elwes) leads to a breakup.
title: The Wait Out

description: George searches for a way to stop his impending nuptials even as he and Susan are selecting their wedding invitations.
title: The Invitations

description: George is ready to move on after mourning the death of his fiancee, while Jerry breaks off his engagement.
title: The Foundation

description: George suspects the attorney for the Susan Ross Foundation believes he murdered Susan; Jerry likes his date.
title: The Soul Mate

description: Elaine's ex introduces her to two of his friends who look like George and Kramer but act like their exact opposites.
title: The Bizarro Jerry

description: Jerry discovers a hidden talent when Kramer gets him to perform an illegal activity; George acts like a rebel.
title: The Little Kicks

description: Kramer tries to scam the post office; Elaine has a rash but has trouble finding a doctor who will treat her.
title: The Package

description: The mentor of Jerry's latest girlfriend (A.J. Langer) is dating a rival (Steve Hytner); Elaine must fire a troubled employee.
title: The Fatigues

description: Jerry is unhappy about receiving bundles of small residual checks from a Japanese TV show; Kramer makes friends with a group of Japanese tourists.
title: The Checks

description: Jerry and Kramer are affected when a celebrity opens a new restaurant in the neighborhood and the eatery's sign shines its neon light directly into Kramer's apartment.
title: The Chicken Roaster

description: George's intellect benefits when his girlfriend's illness requires their abstinence; Elaine experiences the opposite effect; Jerry returns to his junior high school for career day.
title: The Abstinence

description: George competes for a better apartment against a survivor of the Andrea Doria; Kramer visits a vet for his cough.
title: The Andrea Doria

description: George finds his perfect woman (Andrea Bendewald); Kramer names his new pet after Jerry; Elaine dates a bald man.
title: The Little Jerry

description: Jerry's parents (Barney Martin, Liz Sheridan) think he is low on money; J. Peterman (John O'Hurley) resumes his position as Elaine's boss.
title: The Money

description: Jerry joins a tennis club where the pro is a lousy player; George is too late in concocting a witty comeback to an insult.
title: The Comeback

description: George interviews students for the scholarship memorializing his late fiancee; Elaine is hired to ghostwrite J. Peterman's autobiography.
title: The Van Buren Boys

description: A co-worker's mistake forces Elaine to create an alternate personality; Jerry unintentionally becomes a mobster.
title: The Susie

description: George pulls out all the stops to find a commemorative key ring he lost; Jerry drops his girlfriend's toothbrush in the toilet; Kramer adopts a highway.
title: The Pothole

description: Jerry ends up in a weightlifting contest with an older man (Lloyd Bridges); a beautiful woman (Chelsea Noble) mistakes George for her ex-boyfriend.
title: The English Patient

description: George finds the ideal napping spot at work; Jerry has his kitchen rebuilt; Elaine meets a new beau (Vince Grant).
title: The Nap

description: George begins to wonder what his new girlfriend (Suzanne Cryer) isn't telling him when she says, "Yada, yada, yada."
title: The Yada Yada

description: Newman nixes Kramer's millennium-party plans; Jerry obsesses about his position on his girlfriend's speed dial.
title: The Millennium

description: Elaine's new business, selling only the upper part of muffins, is challenged to dispose of the unused bottoms.
title: The Muffin Tops

description: George's plans for a summer getaway are foiled; Elaine's well-meaning criticism of a co-worker is not well-received.
title: The Summer of George

description: Competing comic Bania warms to Jerry's crowds; Elaine and David unite for a European trip; Kramer reconsiders butter.
title: The Butter Shave

description: Jerry finds part of his new date's anatomy of interest; George's job is threatened; Elaine's relationship sputters.
title: The Voice

description: Jerry tries to reveal more of his feelings on the advice of his new girlfriend (Lori Loughlin). With Jason Alexander.
title: The Serenity Now

description: At his parents' insistence, Jerry is coached by personal trainer Izzy Mandelbaum (Lloyd Bridges) to lose weight.
title: The Blood

description: Jerry, promised a vehicle as payment for a performance, winds up getting a van instead of a car; Elaine meets a new man; Kramer has no need for mail.
title: The Junk Mail

description: Jerry has designs on his new date's collection of toys; Kramer discovers furniture with a noteworthy past.
title: The Merv Griffin Show

description: Kramer gets into meat slicing; Jerry dates a doctor (Marcia Cross) who isn't impressed with his job; George's new boss is a former adversary.
title: The Slicer

description: Elaine, Jerry and George go to India for the wedding of Elaine's friend (Brenda Strong); Kramer's death threat.
title: The Betrayal

description: Jerry dates a woman with few inhibitions about her body; George awaits an apology; Kramer researches short showers.
title: The Apology

description: George and his father celebrate an alternative holiday; Kramer goes back to work after a long bagel strike.
title: The Strike

description: Jerry is finally ready to buy a new car, but things don't go very smoothly when he visits Elaine's boyfriend to make the deal.
title: The Dealership

description: Elaine's boyfriend, Puddy, wears a fur coat; Jerry starts living without a wallet; Newman may be evicted.
title: The Reverse Peephole

description: Jerry is aggravated when a woman uses him as a subject for her show; Elaine doesn't understand a cartoon.
title: The Cartoon

description: Jerry keeps finding Kramer's hidden strongbox key; Elaine dates a mysterious man; George plans a breakup.
title: The Strongbox

description: Jerry buys his father (Barney Martin) an organizer but can't make him use it; Kramer retires next to the Seinfelds.
title: The Wizard

description: George learns to leave at the right moment; Jerry has a new girl (Cindy Ambuehl) with a past; Puddy (Patrick Warburton) is religious.
title: The Burning

description: Jerry decides to teach Uncle Leo a lesson after he catches him shoplifting at a bookstore; Elaine humiliates herself at a party.
title: The Bookstore

description: Elaine wolfs down Peterman's (John O'Hurley) pricey cheesecake; Kramer calls in "the guys" for George.
title: The Frogger

description: Jerry (Jerry Seinfeld) begins dating his new maid (Angela Featherstone); George ponders a nickname; Elaine has to get the new area code.
title: The Maid

description: Getting stuck in a Puerto Rican Day traffic jam brings about different responses from Jerry, Elaine, George and Kramer.
title: The Puerto Rican Day

description: Some of the best scenes from nine seasons of "Seinfeld" are brought together in a celebration of the series.
title: The Clip Show (a.k.a. The Chronicle) Part 1 & 2

description: After NBC picks up Jerry and George's sitcom, the four pals are arrested for breaking the good Samaritan law.
title: The Finale Part 1 & 2
